description: Oval sedge (Carex leporina) is an incredibly adaptive and amazing native plant species! It's highly drought-tolerant, resilient to numerous environmental conditions, spreads quickly and can be found in all kinds of habitats. Its structural grass-like foliage can reach up to one meter in height and can provide a wide array of habitats for small animals and insects. Its flowers are tiny and yellow-brown, but its beauty lies in its evergreen foliage, which maintains its green hue all year long. Not to mention how easy it is to maintain in the garden! Oval sedge is truly a marvel of native plants!
